snippet: The nine, from South Africa, Britain and India, were being allowed to return home, according to the South African government and an aid group.
abstract: Nine tourists from South Africa, Great Britain and India who were detained in China after being accused of watching illegal videos in their hotel are released and allowed to return to their home countries; detention had prompted international outcry.
lead_paragraph: The nine, from South Africa, Britain and India, were being allowed to return home, according to the South African government and an aid group.

headline.main: China Releases 9 Tourists Accused of Watching Terrorist Video at Hotel
headline.print_headline: Nine Tourists Held in China Are Released
